intro: Brickellia rosmarinifolia, commonly known as silverleaf brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. The plant features narrow, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences and bloom in the spring. Brickellia rosmarinifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in drought conditions.
